ch.ethz.inspire.emod.utils

Class ComponentConfigReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ethz.inspire.emod.utils.ConfigReader
      • ch.ethz.inspire.emod.utils.ComponentConfigReader

  • public class ComponentConfigReader
extends ConfigReader
    Utility class to extract configuration parameters from a machine component configuration file.

    The constructor opens the configuration file. Then, the user can read the values of the configuration parameters by calling the corresponding methods. The user must know the type (double, double array, double matrix, ...) of the chosen parameter.

    Path and filename: Using the name of the machine component (this is equivalent to the name of the physical model) and the type of the machine component the path and filename is generated as follows: MachineComponentDB/CompenentName/CompenentName_Type.xml

    File Format:
    The component configuration file must be in the following format:
    Example:
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
    <!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd">
    <properties>
    <comment>Some comment</comment>
    <entry key="DoubleParamXY">123.0</entry>
    <entry key="DoubleArrayParamABC">12, 13, 14;</entry>
    <entry key="DoubleMatrixParam123">
    1.1, 2.3, 1.2;
    7.2, 5.3, 9.8;
    </entry>
    </properties>

    Author:
    andreas

      • ComponentConfigReader

        public ComponentConfigReader(java.lang.String component,
                     java.lang.String type)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor opens the parameter definition file and reads the properties. The file must satisfy the XML format and the DTD specification.
        Parameters:
        component - Name of the machine component model
        type - Type of the machine component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if file could not be found or if an unexpected file format occurs.
